title: Paul Singer helps create over $25 million in shareholder value in a day, for himself
text: From marketwatch.com Billionaire investor Paul Singer showed everyone Thursday that the more money you have, the easier it is to create value for shareholders, especially when youre one of them. Elliott Management Corp., the New York-based hedge fund Singer founded, disclosed on Thursday an 8.85 million share, or 6.6% stake, in Polycom Inc. PLCM, +16.70% That would make Elliott the business telecommunications companys fourth-largest shareholder, according to FactSet. Then Elliott tells Polycom it can double sales and boost its stock price by up to 85% in a little over two years if it buys up the outstanding shares of rival Mitel Networks Corp. MITL, ... (
